page.title: 15 BURY FOOTBALL CLUB
page.content:
1985 was the centenary year of Bury F.C. and they gained promotion to the Third Division of the Football League. The club has won the F.A. Cup twice in the early years of the century,beating Southampton 4-0 in 1900 and Derby Co. 6-0 in 1903 ( still a record score ). The playing pitch is one of the largest and best in the country measuring 112 yards by 72 yards and two groundsmen are employed to keep it in good condition. The Club was one of the pioneers of floodlighting in 1953. There is a thriving Social Club and a Junior Shakers Club for children ( The Shakers is the Club nickname ). The ground capacity has recently been drastically reduced to 7,000, but the record gate was 35,000
